title: Preparing Birds for Cooking
brief: Clean and prepare birds while preserving maximum nutritional value.
steps: Step 1: Remove feathers by plucking (preferred) or skinning - skinning removes some food value.
Step 2: Open the body cavity and remove all entrails.
Step 3: Save the craw (in seed-eating birds), heart, and liver for additional nutrition.
Step 4: Cut off the feet at the joints.
Step 5: For scavenger birds: boil for at least 20 minutes before other cooking to kill parasites.
warnings: Scavenger birds require extended boiling (20+ minutes) to kill parasites before final cooking.
Plucking preserves more nutrition than skinning.
Inspect saved organs for signs of disease before eating.
